title: Hylodidae
text:
Hylodidae is a <a href="Family%20%28biology%29">family</a> of <a href="frog">frog</a>s. Whether their <a href="sister%20taxon">sister taxon</a> is the <a href="Dendrobatoidea">Dendrobatoidea</a> or <a href="Alsodidae">Alsodidae</a> is still under debate. They are native to <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a> and northern <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>.
Megaelosia is one species that lost the ability to produce vocalizations which in turn are denoted as mute. Through observation of aggressive interactions, it was found that the species vocal sacs are used for one form of their visual signaling and communication. 
Diversity.
The family contains 46 species in three genera:
